Articles.Content: I've made my own little repository of parts modded to suit for desired size parameters. How about the ability to do this on the fly within the SPH/VAB or a WYSIWYG external application that can be used to make a new part with the desired scale change along with appropriate scalar changes to other part parameters.

There was a part-factory application that did this, you could dial in whatever you wanted and the part would pop out for use in the game

Here is it, generator not factory [PGv2.3]

I was getting confused with fairing factory, so many mods about.

Mmmmmmm.... That's not what I meant. Think existing part input > new part output.

E.g.: I wanted a docking coupler to fit the largest cylindrical parts so I took the Clamp-o-tron Sr., made a new part folder, scaled it 125% and called it the Clamp-o-tron XL. Made it a little heavier, and such, too. Strangely, this method does not always work. parts look good in VAB but are screwy in game (original scale).

Edited July 30, 2013 by LawnDartLeo

You don't need to make a new part folder, you can have multiple .cfg's inside one part folder

I've done this with a few things, copying the cfg and tweaking the rescaleFactor and other stats in the copy
